comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
CWGC has this:

EVANS, DOUGLAS OSMOND

Rank: Second Lieutenant
Date of Death: 08/08/1916
Age: 23
Regiment/Service: The King's (Liverpool Regiment) 1st Bn.
Panel Reference Pier and Face 1 D 8 B and 8 C.
Memorial THIEPVAL MEMORIAL
Additional Information:
Son of Osmond and Clara Evans, of "Beechurst," Station Rd., Harpenden, Herts.

comment.author: 69662531@N05

comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
1911 census - Beechurst, Station Road, Harpenden, Hertfordshire

Osmond Evans - head - 47 - tea buyer - born Fratton, Portsmouth
Clara Evans - wife - 51 - born London
Muriel Evans - daughter - 21 - school teacher - born Clapham, London
Douglas Evans - son - 18 - traveller - born Harpenden
Maurice Evans - son - 12 - scholar - born Harpenden

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: On the Somme in the early hours of 8th August 1916, 1st Battalion King's Liverpool Regiment (6th Brigade) attacked the German held village of Guillemont, the third of 5 attempts to capture the fortified defensive village between July and September.  1st, 1/5th, and 1/8th King's Liverpool battalions attacked in mist and poor visibility. The 1st and 1/8th battalions reached the German front-line trenches and entered the village. Their situation quickly deteriorated in the face of immediate counter-attacks, and the 1/8th's support battalion was driven back by Germans who re-gained and continued to occupy the first-line trenches.  Isolated and contained by counter-attacks, the 1/8th and three companies of the 1st found themselves outflanked and surrounded.  The 1/8th had been annihilated with 15 killed, 55 wounded, and 502 missing, while the 1st Battalion lost its commanding officer, Colonel Goff, and sustained 239 casualties, many were captured having fought-on for 36 hours and expended their ammunition.  The 1st later received a draft of 20 officers and 750 men from the Manchester Regiment.//
